comment: Really entertaining person; meh professor. His lecture are long and boring. No participation necessary. The group work was tedious and weren't value add. As long as you do the work, you'll get a decent grade. Can't tell you what I really learned but happy I got an A.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Forrester is unreachable after class making it difficult to ask questions you have about the material or assignment expectations. You're graded on several group projects, a midterm, final, and several pop quizzes. This course covers tough material but it is made much more difficult by his lackadaisical teaching. Avoid if possible.

His classes are extremely boring and the lectures are too long making everyone zone out. It's mostly him talking without encouraging the students to participate and have effective discussions. We had 2 group projects which were nice + one simulation which wasn't really helpful. We also studied articles every week + discussion posts every week.

Not sure what is up with the negative reviews. Had him for a graduate class and he is 5 stars. Very good lectures and the funniest professor I have ever had. All around entertaining guy and I loved his class
Stay away from this professor. He curves test grades AT THE END of the semester, and his tests are ridiculous! I didnt learn anything in his class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy

comment: His class is beyond boring. He provides a study guide, but is absolutely no help on the test! I'm a marketing major and I am struggling.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Test heavy--Lecture heavy

comment: Extremely condescending at all times. I cant stand listening to him but he takes attendance and points come off your grade starting the first time you miss. Tests are difficult and he doesnt curve until the end of the semester. Would strongly not recommend.
Tough test grader, graded on only a couple things throughout the semester. He's a good guy that will work with you to achieve an okay grade, but it's definitely a tough A to go for.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: Boring lectures, not up to par Marketing MBA class. I'd love to see what an Emory or GA Tech Marketing class is like. He never responds to email. Easy A class but I actually wanted to learn something. He will learn all students names but then lower all expectations. Its group project case studies.

I thoroughly enjoyed this class. Dr. Forrester is very knowledgeable and engaging. I enjoy his sense of humor and the content of his lectures is interesting. He gives great feedback on presentations and assignments.

The class is okay. 3 tests and semester long group project (papers & presentation). He takes attendance at every class. He is extremely boring and the material seems like common sense- however the wording on his tests makes you second guess yourself. His "study guides" aren't helpful either. Good Luck! I would not recommend him.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Easy class, end of chapter summary are the multiple choice tests. Lectures a lot, but is good enough professor. Very strict about attendance. Passes attendance sheet at beginning of every class and sometimes at the end if too many people leave in the middle. Term long marketing project.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: I've only had Forrester for 3 weeks and I know I would never take him again. I went to the restroom and without warning he locked me out of class and continued the lecture. He then allowed me back in and gave a quiz over what he discussed in class while I was exiled from the room. He gave me no opportunity for makeup. I got a 20 because of pee.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--BEWARE OF POP QUIZZES--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Would describe him as an older Sheldon Cooper. Extremely intelligent but quirky. Quizzes that are 15% of your grade every other day. Test are take home essay test that are 20% a piece. Group project that is 30 pages long. Pay attention in class, take notes, and laugh at his jokes. He isn't a super tough grader but takes notice of who is trying.

Dr Forrester is quirky but fun.  There were no tests in this class but it was extremely group-work heavy.  Pick a good group or you will have a miserable semester. He doesn't respond to email at all but is helpful in person if you have questions.  His feedback on papers is thorough and he's a pretty easy grader if you do the work.

Dr Forrester's class in Strategic Marketing was very enjoyable to me. He has a very good sense of humor and his lectures helped improve my business vocabulary. He explains key concepts using real world examples with  humor where applicable. Overall, a very enjoyable course and professor

Not the most exciting class in the world. You will have quizzes pretty much every other class that are worth around 15% of your grade.Make sure you pick good teammates- group projects are a major % of your grade. He is helpful you just have to reach out and ask questions.Doing so will help you get a better grade/understanding.
Worst professor I've ever had
You are out of your mind if you take this professor. Easily the worst professor at KSU. Wish someone had warned me before hand.

A lot of the stuff you'll learn in this class is pretty useful, but you learn it through no means of Forrester's teaching ability. He is a pretty smug and arrogant guy, but he's a lot smarter than you may give him credit for. Expect to make a C or D in his class if you normally make A's and B's in other classes. Take this class at your own risk.
I liked him. Very nice guy, but make sure and attend class and get in good group.

The guy is awesome, but very over the top sometimes. There were a couple of times I asked a question and he brushed me off as if I was annoying him. Attend class!!! It looks better! We did 3 database reports/presentations, take-home midterm, quizzes and a final paper/presentation. Hard work, but it pays off if you take it seriously.
Boring Lecture.  Boring Material.  Very similiar to MKTG research except almost useless b/c of dependence on database research.
Very good teacher.
Knows his stuff, but can be dogmatic.  Sometimes has trouble when people challenge his positions.
I think he wakes up on the wrong side of the bed every morning
Very boring lectures.  Not a very hard class, but really dry and really dull sense of humor.
Knows a lot and will share.  High IQ and sophisticated member of Mensa - not what I expected in a marketing guy.  Easy to make an A if you give it a decent effort.  Optional Final.  Very fair.
Very dry wit.  Read the book to get the complexity of marketing.  Incorporate key concepts to get your A.  Uses the peer evaluation heavily in the grade.

The class is very group project oriented, accounting for about half of your grade.  The mid-term was open book, essay style test.  Talk to the prof while you work on your group projects to get his opinion.  Optional final exam also.
